article.heading: Telephone system
Fixed line
article.paragraph: The Brazilian fixed-line sector is fully open to competition and continues to attract operators. The bulk of the market is divided between four operators: Telefnica, Amrica Mvil, Oi (controlled by Brazilian investors and Portugal Telecom), and GVT (owned by Vivendi). Telefonica operates through Telefonica Brasil, which has integrated its fixed-line and mobile services under the brand name Vivo. The Amrica Mvil group in Brazil comprises long-distance incumbent Embratel, mobile operator Claro, and cable TV provider Net Servios. The group has started to integrate its fixed and mobile services under the brand name Claro, previously used only for mobile services. Oi offers fixed line and mobile services under the Oi brand name. GVT is the countrys most successful alternative network provider, offering fixed-line services only.

article.heading: Mobile
article.paragraph: The history of mobile telephony in Brazil began on 30 December 1990, when the Cellular Mobile System began operating in the city of Rio de Janeiro, with a capacity for 10,000 terminals. At that time, according to Anatel (the national telecommunications agency), there were 667 devices in the country. The number of devices rose to 6,700 in the next year, to 30,000 in 1992. In November 2007 3G services were launched, and increased rapidly to almost 90% of the population in 2012 and the agreements signed as part of the auction specify a 3G coverage obligation of 100% of population by 2019. After the auction that took place in June 2012, LTE tests were undertaken in several cities, tourist locations and international conference venues.cite webhttp://exame.abril.com.br/tecnologia/noticias/claro-testa-4g-em-campos-do-jordao-spClaro testa 4G em Campos do Jordão-SP5 September 2012exame.abril.com.br2 September 2015The first LTE-compatible devices became available in the local market and LTE services was commercially launched in 2013. Under the 4G licence terms, operators were required to have commercial networks in all twelve state capitals which are acting as host cities for the2014 FIFA World Cup.cite webhttp://www.telegeography.com/products/commsupdate/articles/2014/01/07/all-four-4g-licensees-confirmed-as-having-met-end-2013-coverage-deadline/Rostelecom All four 4G licensees confirmed as having met end-2013 coverage deadlineTelegrography7 January 201415 February 2014

article.heading: Television and radio
article.paragraph: Under the Brazilian constitution, television and radio are not treated as telecommunication ways to avoid creating problems with a series of regulations that reduce and control how international businesses and persons participate on it. It is worth mentioning that Brazil has the 2nd biggest media conglomerate in the world in terms of revenue,Rede Globo.
